conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force, consider the forces on each wire segment due to magnetic fields.
Ampere force formula: F = I L x B, where I is current, L is length vector, B is magnetic field vector.
Segment AB has length L, current I, magnetic field B pointing inward.
Force on segment AB: F_AB = I L B, since L is perpendicular to B.
Segment BC has length L, current I, magnetic field B pointing outward.
Force on segment BC: F_BC = I L B, since L is perpendicular to B.
Direction of force on AB is left using right-hand rule.
Direction of force on BC is right using right-hand rule.
Net force is zero as forces on AB and BC cancel each other.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the wire is 0.
